intro: Papaver argemone f. siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian poppy, is a variant of the argemone poppy characterized by its distinctive, bright orange to red flowers. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily, and thrives in well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, cup-shaped blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine. The seeds of this plant are also used in culinary applications, though they should be handled with care due to their mild toxicity.
